Description:
DOWNSIZE, PROFESSIONALS OR INVESTORS
This delightful two-storey residence offers the perfect steppingstone to owning your first home or leaving the family home for a more relaxed, carefree lifestyle.
Offering two levels of style, space, and security with plenty of room for guests and entertaining, inside and out.
The ground floor consists of a tiled entry flanked by spacious north-facing formal lounge and dining areas on the left and living, meals and kitchen areas to the right. Keen cooks will appreciate the kitchen with St George double oven, Miele dishwasher, pantry cupboard and casual dining /breakfast bar. Northern light fills the adjoining meals and living areas fitted with a built-in wall unit.
Upstairs sleeping accommodation includes a large main suite with views over the neighbourhood, walk-in robe and ensuite.
Also, on this level are two more robed bedrooms and bathroom with separate shower and spa bath.
Back on the ground floor you will find separate laundry and powder rooms and sliding doors from the lounge/dining opening to a rear verandah and alfresco courtyard for unwinding and entertaining.
Adjusting to life on a smaller scale will be a pleasure with the beautiful rear garden to tend and the oversized double garage with remote door and attached workshop area.
Additional features include ducted evaporative cooling, gas log fire, zoned floor heating, solar, landscaped allotment with rear private walled garden. Allotment a surprising approx 432m²,
It's a safe, secure sanctuary surrounded by good neighbours in a quiet street within easy walking distance to everything the area is known for - Strath/Kennington Village shops, medical and allied health clinics, LaTrobe University, Kennington Reservoir and parklands with public transport about 600mts. There is no body corporate to worry about here, as you have your own title.
Do not hesitate this chance to secure a sought-after lifestyle in a prime position will not last.

IMMACULATE TOWNHOUSE IN STUNNING ST AIDANS PARK
This stunning property is located in a row of stylishly-built beautiful townhouses, created to sit alongside the old St Aidans Orphanage and the grounds surrounding. Perfectly situated in easy walking distance from Strath Village, Strath Hill and Kennington Reservoir.
The private front yard sits behind a picket fence and the front deck is the perfect place to sit and smell the roses. Indoors, a dedicated entry hall leads into the formal lounge a spacious and light-filled room with a large picture window. Between this room and the open plan kitchen, living and dining room beyond is a large euro laundry, neatly tucked away, as well as a full powder room. The kitchen features granite benchtops, quality appliances and under bench storage on both sides of the generous island.
Carpeted stairs lead from the front lounge to the second floor and a skylight above the stairwell, as well as in the family bathroom, offers additional natural light. Two good-sized bedrooms overlook the rear yard and the generous master is positioned to make the most of the outlook across the formal gardens. Glass doors from the master lead out to a balcony, providing plenty of light and beautiful sunrise views over the city. This room also features a large walk-in robe, and an ensuite providing a beautiful outlook of the estate and beyond from the cathedral window.
Downstairs, the backyard can be access via the main living space. Glass sliding doors lead out to a decked alfresco area and private lawn. At the end of the easy-care garden is the double garage, which is accessed via a private driveway set aside strictly for tenants.
Additional features include:
Reverse cycle ducted refrigerative cooling and heating
Modern kitchen appliances including dishwasher, oven and four-burner gas cooktop
Great storage throughout
Access to double garage via private driveway
Body corporate fees include garden maintenance
With a flexible layout, plenty of space and storage, and positioned a short walking distance to all amenities, this low-maintenance and secure property is perfect for a buyer wanting to sit back and enjoy the easy life in an immaculate, contemporary home.

Set on an established and manageable town allotment, the premium location is a sought after luxury. Offering a short walk to and from the city centre for work, or a leisurely stroll to enjoy the city's renowned galleries, cafés, restaurants and shopping, you can simplify your lifestyle (and your carbon footprint) by enjoying the convenience of being central to everything!
The totally renovated home is a credit to the current owners, and has left nothing for the new owner to do. The renovations have been sympathetic to the era of the original home, meaning its's character and charm remain in tact. Perfect for singles, couples and young families alike, this sort of hassle-free city lifestyle is highly sought after in today's market. In very solid order, features include beautiful polished hardwood floors, high ceilings, timber windows, plenty of natural light, updated kitchen and bathrooms, new roofing, fresh painting, and split system heating and cooling to name a few.
Internally, the deceptively large floor plan boasts four carpeted bedrooms, or three plus a generous study (it's up to you?). The spacious master suite is complete with walk in robe and its own modern three piece ensuite! The main bathroom has also been fully modernised and includes shower, bath and separate toilet. The central hallway lined with gorgeous timber floors leads to the rear, and opens to the huge open plan kitchen meals and spacious living area. Lovely big windows and glass doors allow plenty of natural light. The spacious kitchen has been wonderfully renovated with all the mod cons included. Boasting expansive bench tops, up to date cooking appliances, dishwasher, and loads of cupboard space, you cant help but be impressed. The living space is light bright and airy, roomy enough for a gathering of lots of friends or family (or intimate enough for two) with fabulous sunny views to the deck area.
Outside is a good sized allotment; its size (approx 733m2) is more than generous for inner city living. With a lovely established garden and landscaped yard already in place, you won't become a slave here! The sun deck at the back door provides a great space to entertain guests and have breakfast, and it flows further into a covered and enclosed space that is perfect for the cooler months. At the rear of the covered space is a laundry, separate toilet, and a handy bike/storage room. A large garden shed is existing, with plenty of space to construct a larger shed if needed. There is a nice yard at the side, with the lawn area an ideal spot for a pool if desired. Off street parking is provided for multiple cars, including a double carport. All this behind the attractive white picket fence that everyone craves so much!
Ideally suited to those looking to experience the convenience of inner city living, you must visit this property to truly appreciate what it could offer you. It will honestly be love at first sight! Given its location and broad appeal, you had better act quick as it surely will not last long!

Description:
GREAT BONES!
A typical home of its era - built to last with old school building techniques and quality products that are hard to find in modern home design. Popular cream brick veneer, terracotta tiled roof, hardwood frame, polished timber floors and concrete stumps. Yes this home is arguably as solid as it was the day it was built!
This means great bones for you to retain as is, update, renovate, extend or simply put some great tenants in there making it a wise investment.
The home is positioned on a 483m2 corner lot in elevated Marshall Crescent surrounded by neat and tidy homes. It boasts a spacious lounge room on entry with mantel, gas heater, reverse-cycle split-system and polished timber floors; there is the adjacent meals area and the original but well-kept kitchen including ample cabinetry and overhead cupboards, bench-top gas hot plates and oven, double sink and a Dishlex dishwasher. To the side of the meals space is separate sunroom-come-study nook.
Three spacious bedrooms, two have built-in-robes, two have trendy corner windows and they all have polished floorboards! The family bathroom is almost original, but in great order, there's a shower, basin and separate bath.
The laundry is a good size and has a double trough; the toilet is separate.
Outside, there is the original cream brick fence, a double carport with easy parking access and lots of scope to add your own touch outside.
Position is superb, transport is handy, it is a short walk to Primary Schools, close to Kennington Village and Strath Village and five mins to Bendigo's CBD.
Be quick and take advantage of one of Kennington's most sough-after locations!
